summary: The text discusses various legal documents related to Nepal laws, including the National Directives Act of 2018, Amendment Act of 2019, and National Directives (Amendment) Act of 2021. These laws aim to regulate and amend existing laws, ensuring the proper functioning of different sectors and organizations in Nepal. The laws also empower the government to make necessary amendments for the development and welfare of the country.

summary: The National Judicial Council Act of 2063 regulates the establishment and functioning of the National Judicial Council in Nepal. It aims to enhance the capacity and efficiency of judicial officers, employees, and legal professionals, as well as promote research and study in the field of law. The Act establishes the central office of the Council in Kathmandu, with the possibility of opening branch offices as needed. The Council is an autonomous and organized institution with the authority to acquire, use, and dispose of both movable and immovable property. Individuals can also conduct transactions on behalf of the Council.

summary: The National Identity Card and Registration Act of 2076 aims to establish a system for the registration of personal details and issuance of national identity cards to Nepali citizens. The law also includes provisions for the development of a national identity management information system to support national development plans and security services. The Act outlines the roles and responsibilities of registration officers and defines terms related to personal data storage and management. The law was enacted by the Federal Parliament to streamline the process of identity verification and registration in Nepal.

summary: The text discusses the National Identity Card and Registration Regulations of Nepal, published in the Nepal Gazette in 2077. It outlines the procedures for registration and issuance of national identity cards, as well as the responsibilities of individuals and authorities involved in the process. The regulations also specify the requirements for obtaining citizenship certificates and the documentation needed for registration. The development and implementation of the national identity system are emphasized, along with the use of electronic mediums for application submission.

summary: The text discusses the National Examination Board Regulations of 2076 published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the amendments made to the Education Act of 2028 and the establishment of rules by the government. The regulations define the functions and responsibilities of the board, including conducting examinations, evaluating systems, and implementing necessary reforms. It also addresses the organization and procedures of board meetings, the certification of board employees, and the decision-making process within the board.
